content.description:
Climb the easy (4th to low 5th) slab ramp shared with "The Raven and the Bear" to the steepest part of the wall/small bulge. Pull a slightly awkward but not altogether difficult sequence to gain the face. All that's left is stellar face climbing to the chains! Generally thin and some tricky side pull/traversing sequences.

After the first rightward traverse on the face there is a bolt on your right. Stay on the left bolt line, this aforementioned bolt heads for a 12b exit (Juno Beach).

Draw beta- long draw the first bolt on the bulge (first bolt after the slab). It helps if there's a draw on the first bolt on the face, then you can high clip and avoid a bit of nasty fall potential.



Head up the trail towards the right end of Raven's Castle. Locate the slab and look for the bolt line that breaks off the slab through the steepest section (second bolt line from the left).

10 bolts, chains (no biners)

Shares the first two bolts with The Squirrel and the nuthatch. Veer left; slabby and fun!

10 bolts to permadraws at the top

Climb easy terrain through a couple of bolts to the bottom gate keeper boulder (~5.12/12+) involving big moves on good holds to 3 good rests broken up by short sections of tricky, technical face climbing. Punch it starting at the second last bolt all the way to the show stopping heart breaker boulder finish!

Long draw bolt 3 for efficiency. 



First bolt is just left of a arete/roof. The bolt line goes up the steepest section of the wall and is independent of all the other bolt lines. 

9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

Climb the face to a cracky roof, pull some locks and climb the crimpy face above to a bolted anchor.



On the east face of Raven's Castle.

Bolts

A tricky move off the deck gains you good holds up until a rest before the meat of the climb. Chalk up and be ready for balancey movement on nasty crimps and at least one fairly big, desperate move and an equally desperate clip. Traverse left through an easier section that spits off many climbers before gaining a high rest. 

Finally, power up for a bouldery sequence shared with "Surface of the Sun".

**Consider stick clipping the second bolt- the clipping holds for both the first and second bolt are a little bit suspect even though the clips are fine. 

Draw beta- long draw bolts 5,6,7, 9. Skip 8 if your 9th is already pre hung. 



Right side of Ravens Castle, the bolt line that starts near the arete (first line left of the "Tradjectory" corner) Take the left branches.

9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

Crimpy all the way on a slightly slabby wall.

Eastern Side of Raven's Castle, just left of the deep chimney.
6 bolts

This is a very unique route that's "hugely entertaining" as Howie Richardson's guidebook states. Slab, mini-roofs, great holds, fun movement, and super enjoyable. Shady belay spot. Some feel that this is a 5.8, some that it is a 5.10a. Classic. 
  
 Note: You'll need someone to follow you to clean this route.

Just above a steep section of ground, it's the left-most route on the ledge below the orange wall. Starts on the obvious slab.
11 bolts.

Shares the first two bolts with Dragons play and veers left. Slabby and fun!

Ravens castle, south. Start on a ledge with red bolts. 
11 bolts to permadraws at the top

Easy terrain leads you to a small, challenging rightward traverse. From here, power up to head back left on a series of good, but far apart holds through the bulge with a mid sequence clip. Climb beautifully set face to a high rest before launching into one final bouldery sequence with a heart breaking last move!

Draw beta: Unclip bolt one, long draw bolt 6 and 10. 



Right side of Ravens Castle, 2nd bolt line left of the "Tradjectory" corner. Links up with "Into the Frying Pan" up high. 

10 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners

An overhanding corner. It's a thrash up, with an assortment of jams, locks, and tricky stemming. It was originally climbed on gear then retro bolted. The bolts are all in good positions.

Upper portion of Raven's Castle, in an obvious overhanging corner just to the right of the orange wall.
7 bolts, chain anchors.

Quite a deceptive route with a slightly different character than other Skaha routes.  The crux comes about a third of the way up passing a right facing groove.  A welcome rest follows the crux and then another difficult and hard to read sequence leads to a pumpy run to the anchor.

5 feet to the right of The Raven and the Bear, head up the same ramp but continue straight past the left facing corner to the first bolt. 
Bolts

Tricky start and fun moves in the upper crack.

7 bolts

This crag has a surprising number of hard climbs, many of which are rated highly. It also hosts a unique and classic moderate - The Raven and the Bear (5.10a sport). You won't find too many people in this area as its not that popular.
